title: This should be illegalâ€¦ PC Audio Product Scams from Elfidelity
description: Its no secret their chairs are great! Check out Secret Lab at   Create your build at   Your PC is finally done: the cable management is perfect, you found the ideal peripherals, and youre still using the onboard sound from your motherboard? That seems like another opportunity to upgrade! But watch out: theres trickery afoot in the audiophile world - and we can prove it.  Discuss on the forum:   Buy a pair of JBL Tune 510BT Wireless On-Ear Headphones:  Buy a pair of Skullcandy Crusher Evo Wireless Over-Ear Headphones:  Check out the Massdrop x Sennheiser HD 6XX Headphones:  Check out the Massdrop x Sennheiser HD 58X Jubilee Headphones:  Buy an xDuoo XP-2 Pro Bluetooth DAC/Amp:  Buy an xDuoo TA-30 Tube Headphone Dac/Amp:  Buy a Thermaltake Smart 500w 80+ White PSU:  Buy a Corsair RM1000x PSU:  Buy a Furman PST-2+6 AC Power Conditioner:  Buy an APC UPS Battery Backup and Surge Protector:  Purchases made through some store links may provide some compensation to Linus Media Group.   GET MERCH:   LTX 2023 TICKETS AVAILABLE NOW:   GET EXCLUSIVE CONTENT ON FLOATPLANE:   SPONSORS, AFFILIATES, AND PARTNERS:   OUR WAN PODCAST GEAR:   FOLLOW US  ---------------------------------------------------   Twitter:  Facebook:  Instagram:  TikTok:  Twitch:   MUSIC CREDIT --------------------------------------------------- Intro: Laszlo - Supernova Video Link:  iTunes Download Link:  Artist Link:   Outro: Approaching Nirvana - Sugar High Video Link:  Listen on Spotify:  Artist Link:   Intro animation by MBarek Abdelwassaa  Monitor And Keyboard by vadimmihalkevich / CC BY 4.0   Mechanical RGB Keyboard by BigBrotherECE / CC BY 4.0  Mouse Gamer free Model By Oscar Creativo / CC BY 4.0   CHAPTERS --------------------------------------------------- 0:00 Intro 1:17 Onboard sound drawbacks 1:56 Is Elfidelity the answer? 3:13 Promises and reviews 4:33 How? And why? 6:01 Installation 7:44 A closer look 9:09 Results 9:40 Audio warning 11:08 It gets worse 12:11 Look on the bright side 13:16 Outro

One user might prefer more bass, while another might like to enhance vocals through software equalization, but the hardware should aim to avoid altering the character of the sound or adding any unnecessary noise. Of course, if you've ever used an onboard sound card, you probably know that these basic solutions sometimes fall well short of that mark. Most onboard audio is decent these days, but I've personally encountered everything from slight background hissing, (static hissing) to loud ticking noises (electronic ticking) every time I move the mouse. However, for a system fan, I have a very hard time believing that it would affect your onboard audio. Okay. Neat. Actually, before we fire the system up, I think it's worth taking a closer look at these RAM filters. They're a bit different from the other Elfidelity products. Instead of being covered in colorful candy capacitors, we get a pair of these NEC/TOKIN proadlizers, which are basically high performance capacitors. The reason these particular chips surprised me so much is that I've seen them before on GPUs, motherboards, and perhaps most notoriously, on the PlayStation 3, where they are known point of failure as documented in this 259 page form discussion that is actually still getting updates and replies. Now, assuming that these are genuine, it makes me kind of question my assumptions here.
